name: Umi London

reviews.text: I stayed at the Umi on the backside of a trip to London, then Plymouth, then back to London. I chose this hotel because it was available with AA miles. The Bayswater location was excellent, in a great area surrounded by wonderful restaurants. Very comfortable walking about at night; and so close to the Tube and bus lines. The room I had (#108) was very noisy though, because it was above the office. I heard doors banging all night every night for four nights. The room was very dated, the furniture very shabby, but the bed was clean, the bathroom okay, and the price was right. I love the area and would probably stay at this hotel again, knowing that it is well located, but I would request a different room for sure.
reviews.title: Great location, a bit shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We left a lot of money in this hotel to get basically a really loud room where you can hear anyone passing by on the floor, a cleaning lady that storms at you in the morning without knocking, and receptionists who doesn`t tell you that you pay twice*
reviews.title: loud with incompetent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *they block the total sum on your account at your check-in that won`t be available for 2 weeks after your check-out. So when you leave you actually pay again from the part of your account that is actually still not blocked.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The area is wonderful but I`d choose another hostel next time.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good.

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights at this hotel. The decor at the visitors' lounge, dining and reception area were a lot better than I had expected. The staff were friendly and cheerful. Our room was clean and had a lovely view.
reviews.title: Umi London - Perfect Location and Price

reviews.text: I found the staff very friendly and helpful and the rooms exactly what I expected. It was a nice surprise when I got back from my travels elsewhere to find that I was in a double room. Very nice.
reviews.title: Will definitely stay here again when in London

reviews.text: Looking for somewhere cheap in London for your family? This could be it. Very easy to get around from here - Tube, Bus, Feet, Bike. Plenty of options. Same with restaurants nearby - French, Indian, Mexican & more all within 5-10 minute walk. Pub 2 minutes, laundry 2 minutes. Small supermarket 5 minutes. Larger shopping center (Queensway about 10 minute walk).
reviews.title: Location great, Hotel OK, Service Ordinary

reviews.text: The rooms were clean & comfortable enough. Shower worked well. It's just old & in need of upgrading. However - you get what you pay for. The service was very average, friendly enough when you could get their attention, I didn't feel they were very helpful, they could try a bit harder.
reviews.title: Visiting London for the first time

reviews.text: Felt pretty safe in the neighbourhood. Plenty of posh places nearby, even saw a major celb at the grocery store. Not sure if I'd stay here again. Probably bite the bullet & spend a bit more somewhere else.
reviews.title: If you like to share your bedroom with mice, go ahead

reviews.text: Internet charges were over the top for a 3 star hotel.
reviews.title: Ignore all the bad reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in June. The hotel was in a good location and breakfasts were good and staff were friendly. I think it is good value for the location. BUT if you can avoid staying in the very top floor where we were, I would. It seemed to be where they put the backpackers or groups and so it was noisy and you also have to cart your case up a flight of stairs. We had an extra bunk in our room (which we did not use) and it made the room extremely small. Our friends stayed on level one and paid a little extra for coffee bags and a deluxe room which I think is worth it if you can afford it. Their room was a lot nicer than ours on the top floor.
reviews.title: Good hotel, nice location, good breakfast
Great location, clean and friendly
reviews.text: Stayed with my wife earlier this year when we were visiting family, facilities were of a high standard and our room very clean. There was a bit of noise, but it is London afterall! Staff were all friendly and well informed. Would stay their again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are a couple in their 30's and stayed in Umi in June for a few nights during our visit to London. This hotel is not bad if you are on a budget and only need a bed to sleep. The hotel is close to a good selection of restaurants with metro station in 5 minutes' walking distance. The reception is quite helpful.
reviews.title: If you only need a place to sleep, this is it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, we found it noisy as we can hear ppl walking both upstairs and in the corridor. The room is quite small with a tiny bathroom smelling of fresh paint. The room is quite old with stained carpets. Free WI FI is not available. The worst to me is their breakfast with very limited choices and quality is very average.
reviews.title: Room ok but very loud.

reviews.text: In summary, this is a budgeted hotel so donot expect a luxury service. However, we may opt for a better quality hotel at a reasonably higher price.
reviews.title: Budget Friendly with Great Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great value hotel in a quiet area of Bayswater and only 5 minutes from Bayswater tube station making the rest of London easily accessible. The room we stayed in was comfortable, quiet and meticulously clean. Booking in was quick and painless. All the staff I encountered were friendly, polite and only too willing to help with advice and assistance. All in all the place had a nice relaxed ambience about it . Given the price we paid the Umi surpassed our expectations and we will definitely be staying there again the next time we visit London.
reviews.title: very pleased

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the UMI London hotel this October. Me and my husband had travelled to London to visit our daughter. Whilst he went to pick her up I decided to go to the hotel to check in. I'd arrived around 1:00pm but was too early as check in time was at 2pm. I was greeted by two very welcoming receptionist. One of them named Selay was very helpful during the whole stay. She made sure I could check in at 1pm by moving things around as I looked completely tired out and needed a lie down. After checking in I wasn't very happy with the room as it was too small for my liking. So she also managed to move me to another room even though it was completely busy at reception. It was definitely a very pleasant stay after that.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay with great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd recommend anyone to stay here considering how friendly the staff is. The two receptionist Selay and the trainee girl at reception that day definitely made it worthwhile.
reviews.title: STEALING STAFF/ NEVER STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at Umi Hotel August 2011 for one week before a tour and one night post a tour. Firstly half the receotion staff were very friendly but the other half had no work ethic, were rude and would continue talking about their weekend without serving customers.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location but beware of the dodgy man....

reviews.text: I travel regularly and always look my suitcases whereve possible when I am not in the room. I had washed a black cardigan that morning and left it hanging over the back of a chair to dry, I was out of the room from 0700-2000hrs. When I arrived back my room had been cleaned and given fresh towels but my cardigan was missing. I went down to the hotel reception and they assured me apart from the cleaners noone else would have entered the room and they would check with the cleaners the next day. I followed this up and the answers were "noone told us to forward on this message and the cleaners have gone" (different reception staff) so I waited another 2 days until I received a reply stating they had no seen it it had not been accidently taken with the towels and that "IT MUST BE IN MY TRUNK" no it is not in my trunk i have looked multiple times, this issue was never resolved.
reviews.title: Great find!

description: Hotel with modern amenities overlooks a pretty garden square; near Kensington Palace, Portobello Road Market & Queensway Station.
